answer:
The text provided conflates the number of languages spoken in Switzerland with the number of languages used in Switzerland. It does not specify a time frame for the number of languages spoken. Therefore I have to make an assumption that the text refers to the current situation.

There are five official languages in Switzerland. These are German, French, Italian, Romansh, and Serbo-Croatian. There are also many unofficial languages spoken in Switzerland. Of the official languages, Swiss German is the most commonly spoken
